meanings.definition: A bract or scale-like structure that surrounds a flower head.
meanings.sent1: The phyllary protected the delicate flower head.
meanings.sent2: The phyllary added a touch of color to the flower arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The phyllary tried to hide behind the flower head, playing a game of peekaboo.
meanings.sent4: The phyllary stood guard around the flower head like a loyal knight.
meanings.sent5: The phyllary, like a colorful shield, shielded the flower head from harm.

meanings.definition: One of the small bracts or scales that make up the involucre of a composite flower.
meanings.sent1: She carefully examined each phyllary of the composite flower.
meanings.sent2: The phyllaries of the flower were arranged in a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the phyllary as a tiny umbrella during the rain.
meanings.sent4: The phyllary, like a tiny puzzle piece, completed the composite flower.
meanings.sent5: The phyllary danced in the wind, making the composite flower come alive.
